p: Although many viral features, including genome length and strandedness, are phylogenetically conserved, only 11 of 104 (10.6%) binary family and genus variables were estimated to have non-zero relative influence in any model, with a combined mean relative influence of only 2.66% ( S2 Table). We did not observe significant changes in AUC scores or the trait profile after removing taxonomy variables from the model ( S2 Table), suggesting that the covariates in our model capture the majority of the important family- and genus-wide traits that underpin secondary human transmission.
